pr_title: [WFCORE-4748] Allow the MODULE_OPTS to be set

timeline.message:
[WFCORE-4748] Allow the MODULE_OPTS to be set and if an -javaagent: is found in the options automatically add jboss-modules as an agent to the VM.

https://issues.redhat.com/browse/WFCORE-4748

[WFCORE-4748] Allow the MODULE_OPTS to be set and if an -javaagent: is found in the options automatically add jboss-modules as an agent to the VM.

https://issues.redhat.com/browse/WFCORE-4748

[WFCORE-4748] Allow the MODULE_OPTS to be set and if an -javaagent: is found in the options automatically add jboss-modules as an agent to the VM.

https://issues.redhat.com/browse/WFCORE-4748

timeline.bodyText: Just for the record regarding these script changes; we are going to need to adapt the specific scripts used for the product conversion as well
timeline.author: yersan
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -82,3 +82,6 @@ rem # Uncomment and edit to use a custom java.security file to override all the
 rem set "JAVA_OPTS=%JAVA_OPTS% -Djava.security.properties==C:\path\to\custom\java.security"
 
 :JAVA_OPTS_SET
+
+rem # Uncomment to add a Java agent
+rem set "MODULE_OPTS=-javaagent:agent.jar"

replies.bodyText: I guess I didn't realize we had custom scripts to those. Can you point me to them so I can have a look?
replies.author: jamezp

replies.bodyText:
Hello James, sure:
https://github.com/jbossas/wildfly-to-product/commits/wf-to-cd
Take a look at "Community to EAP conversion -- Bring in EAP-specific scripts "
replies.author: yersan
